title: City2Scene: Improving Acoustic Scene Classification with City Features
author: Yiqiang Cai (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University), Yizhou Tan (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University), Peihong Zhang (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University), Yuxuan Liu (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University), Shengchen Li (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University), Xi Shao (Nanjing University of Posts and Telecommunications), Mark D. Plumbley (University of Surrey)
relevance_why: The paper's focus on acoustic scene classification relates closely to Haohe Liu's work on audio generation and enhancement, particularly through leveraging contextual features, which can inform audio quality improvement.
background: Acoustic Scene Classification (ASC) aims to categorize audio clips based on environmental sounds, facilitating advancements in applications such as smart devices and environmental monitoring.
contribution: This paper introduces the City2Scene framework to enhance ASC by incorporating city features, demonstrating improved classification accuracy through knowledge distillation techniques.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous ASC approaches have primarily focused on common acoustic features across cities, often neglecting city-specific characteristics which can aid in scene distinctions.
technical_comparison.novelty: City2Scene shifts this paradigm by training a city classification model and utilizing its frozen features to inform scene classification, thus capturing unique city acoustic patterns.

key_innovation: Employs knowledge distillation to transfer city-specific sound characteristics to scene classification models, benefiting both CNNs and Transformers.
real_world_impact: This framework could significantly improve the efficacy of smart devices by enhancing their environment recognition capabilities, leading to more personalized user experiences.
limitations: The paper did not report any significant limitations explicitly, but potential challenges could revolve around the generalization of city-specific knowledge across diverse environments.

new_terms.knowledge distillation: **Knowledge distillation** is a process in machine learning where a smaller or simpler model (student) is trained to replicate the output of a larger, more complex model (teacher), often leading to improved performance of the student model.
